В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мунара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку молодого скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Мунара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, для того чтобы улучшить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en: Munara is 26 years old and has two children.  She got married after finishing school.  To provide the primary source of income, she and her husband became involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business with 50,000 som.  Thanks to Munara's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows, two calves, five sheep, five goats and thirty cases of bee hives.  The monthly income from the business amounts to about 15,000 som.  In order to further develop her business, Munara requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further increase of domestic livestock quantities in order to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Gereltuya

texts.en:
Gereltuya is 31 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ger in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband, Monhbat, works at the local police department as an officer. Her 2 children, Olziibayar and Osohbayar, 9 and 2 go to primary school and kindergarten. 

She has been operating her business of clothes retailing since 2009 and has gained lot of experience over the years. She and her husband are building a house for the family in order to improve their living conditios. She is now requesting 1'500'000MNT to purchase vacuum windows to install her newly built house in order to decrease the heat loss. She is an open-minded and positive person.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum windows to install in her newly built house in order to decrease the heat loss.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba is a very hardworking person who is very enterprising.  She is taking out a new loan to expand her car wash business. With this new loan, she will buy a water pump for her car wash business.   She is very optimistic and she is sure she will have increased income.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 30 years old.  She stopped her education in the 10th grade, married and now lives in Paynesville South with their two children that are 5 and 12 and attend school.  She has had a mini provision shop for the past ten years where she sells soft drinks, bread, sardines, hair grease, pens, pencils, biscuits, oats, bath and washing soap and many other items.   She loves to work at the shop because she makes a profit.  With the profit generated from the business, she will buy more goods, to increase her sales, and attend to the needs of her children.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, sardines, hair grease, biscuits, and bath soap for the shop.  Her plan is to build house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, sardines, hair grease, biscuits, and bath soap for her shop.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 49 years old and lives in Kakata.  She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 15 and 20, all of them attend school.  For the past seven years she has been selling dry pepper in the local market.  She enjoys her business because she has a lot of customers, and the profit she generates help her buy food for her family.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry pepper for her business.  She plans to build a house and send her children to college in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more dry pepper for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 51 years old and married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Vevencia has a general store in the Philippines. Vevencia requested a loan of  21000 PHP through NWTF to purchase grocery items like soft-drinks, detergent and other groceries.

Vevencia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Vevencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like soft-drinks, detergent and other groceries.

loans.name: Hishigsuren

texts.en: Mr.Hishigjargal is 68 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger in Bulgan province Mongolia. His wife Olziijargal helps him to manage his organic dairy products production. His daughter Batzaya, is 23 years old and works in Japan as a contract worker and his son Battulga, 21 years old, studies at the national university of Mongolia. He has been managing organic dairy products production for over 22 years with his wife and they are appreciated among local customers with their high quality organic dairy products. He is requesting 1'500'000MNT to purchase a large amount of forage for his cattle to feed on during the winter. He is hardworking, responsible and an honest person.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of forage for his cattle to feed on during the winter.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old single man. 
For the past five years, Mahmoud has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but also it needs more support to cover costs.
Mahmoud is requesting a loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing some necessary spare parts for the taxi he drives, such as mirrors, lights and wheels. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Mahmoud to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve his income positively and ensure to him better future.
Mahmoud is photographed next to his taxi.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To  purchase some necessary spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

NWTF is relisting Lilibeth's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 23-year-old single man. He works as a car mechanic since 2001. In 2005 he started his own business to improve his income and living.
He is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special car scanner necessary to his business, and to fix the floor next to his shop.
Rabih is a hard worker, who puts so much effort on improving and developing his business in a well managed way.
Rabih has been an Al Majmoua borrower for two consecutive cycles, his previous loan as he describes helped him a lot. He was able to put a big tent in front of the shop and expanded his working area to facilitate his work.
In addition to his mechanical work, he also sells spare parts and used engines to make more profit and increase his income.
He hopes to move to a bigger place in the future and expects more customers.

loans.use: To buy a special car scanner necessary to his business, and to fix the floor next to his shop.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama is requesting a new loan to expand on her existing business. With the previous loan, she was able to buy more cereals hence increasing her income. This new investment will allow her to buy more cereals for sale. Her goal is to see her family's living standards improved. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for the support given.

loans.use: to purchase more cereal for resale.

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 44 years old and lives in Kakata. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have five children between the ages of 6 and 25 years old. Only three of these children live at home with them.

For the past five years, Yamah has been selling red oil, rice, charcoal, vita, and salt in her community. Sometimes there are fewer customers. but most often she gets a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase red oil, rice, charcoal, vita, salt, okra, and bitter ball for her business. In the future. she hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to purchase red oil, rice, charcoal, vita, salt, okra, and bitter ball for her business.

loans.name: Jeanneth

texts.es:
La Sra. Jeanneth es una mujer valiente, madre soltera con dos hijos a los cuales ama con todo su corazón y lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante,  Jeanneth  se define como una persona emprendedora , humilde y muy luchadora por alcanzar sus metas, hace todo por el amor a sus dos hijos.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se empleara en la adecuación de la tienda, en la compra de estanterías y vitrinas para la colocación y exhibición de los productos que existe en la tienda, además hace falta comprar algunos productos de consumo masivo los cuales no tiene y es muy solicitado por sus clientes.

El sueño que Jeanneth tiene es el tener su propio micro mercado, y una pequeña bodega de productos de primera necesidad para vender en su ciudad, y con estos ingresos poder comprarse una casa y darles una mejor vida a sus hijos a los cuales ama con su propia vida
texts.en:
Jeanneth is a brave woman. She is a single mother with two children whom she loves with all her heart. She fights day after day to move them ahead. Jeanneth is characterized as an entrepreneurial and humble woman, very willing to fight to achieve her goals. She does everything for the love of her two children.

The loan requested from Fodemi will be used to adapt her store and purchase shelves and display cases to place and display the products in the store. She also needs to buy some mass consumer products she does not have that her customers ask for a lot.

Jeanneth's dream is to have her own mini-market and a small store selling staple goods in her city, and to be able to buy herself a house with this income and give her children, whom she loves with her own life, a better life.

loans.use: to adapt her store and purchase shelves and display cases to place and exhibit the products in the store

loans.name: La Vaquita De  Cayambe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta conformado por tres personas, las cuales quieren tener una oportunidad de crecimiento economico en la agricultura que es lo que mas les gusta, tienen las ganas de salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia

La presidenta de este gruo es la señora Hilda, una persona humilde del paramo ecuatoriano, con valores como la honradez, la responsabilidad, el trabajo y el amor incondicional a su familia, es por estas razones que la ven como una persona digna de representar a su grupo solidario, y por lo que se a ganado el amor de su comunidad.

El credito solicitado a Fodemi es para invertir en la compra de una vaca reproductora y de un ternerito con la idea de que esto sea el inicio de tener muchas cabezas de ganado.

El sueño que Hilda tiene es el tener un finca cerca de su casa donde pueda tener muchos animalitos y pueda sacar leche para la venta en la ciudad, tener a su familia junto a ella y ayudarles a sus hijos en darles una buena educacion que sus padres  no tuvieron cuando eran niños.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three people.  They want to have the opportunity to grow financially in farming, which is what they like the most.  They have a great desire to get ahead, to improve their incomes, and to meet their families’ needs.

Hilda is the president of this group.  She is a humble person from the barren Ecuadorian highlands.  She has values like honor, responsibility, work, and unconditional love for her family.  It is for these reasons that she is seen as a person worthy of representing her communal bank.  She has also, therefore, won over the love of her community.

The loan requested from Fodemi is to buy a cow for breeding and a calf.  This purchase will be the start to having a lot of head of cattle.  Hilda’s dream is to have a farm close to her house where she is able to have a lot of animals.  She wants to be able to milk the cows and sell the milk in the city.  She also wants to have her family together with her and to help give her children a good education, which their parents did not have when they were children.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding and a calf.

loans.name: Ismenia Delfina

texts.es:
Ismenia, se dedica a la venta de atol, elotes, ella vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, se dedica a la venta desde hace 7 años, vendiendo todos los días por las tardes.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, azúcar, canela, y otros materiales que son necesarios para la producción del atol, este crédito ayudara a tener más disponibilidad de materiales para sus ventas y de esta manera crear más ingresos.
Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia, especialmente a sus hijos para que estudien preparándose para el futuro.
texts.en:
Ismenia earns her living selling maize drinks (atol) and corn on the cob, a job she's been doing for seven years every day in the afternoons. She lives with her husband and two children.

She is seeking a loan to buy corn, sugar, cinnamon, and other ingredients needed to make atol. The loan will enable her to have more money available to buy supplies and thus earn more money. Ismenia's goal is to support her family, especially her children so that they can study and prepare for the future.

loans.use: Buy corn, sugar and cinnamon

loans.name: Freddy Wilmer

texts.es:
FREDDY WILMER tiene 23 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

FREDDY WILMER se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza, plantas de cacao. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes y las plantas para las siembras. 

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 

El sueño es crecer mucho, invertir en la agricultura. En el tiempo libre le gusta parcticar el deporte.
texts.en:
Freddy Wilmer, age 23, is in a common-law marriage and does not have children.  He lives in the Ventanas province in Los Ríos.

He is a member of the Avanza communal bank.  The members are farmers, and all of them live in the Aqua Frías precint.  Virtually all of them were raised in this area.  For the most part, they work in agriculture or with livestock.

Freddy Wilmer grows corn, cacao, and rice.  He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer, and cacao plants.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy fertilizers and the plants for sowing.

He will make his purchases and his sales in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.  The challenges he faces are pest infestations and bad weather.

His dream is to grow a lot, and to invest in agriculture.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer, and cacao plants.

loans.name: Jose Magdaleno

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de cocos, periódicos y recargas de celulares, vive con su esposa en casa de su familia. El realiza sus ventas en el centro de la ciudad, tiene un carretón en el que vende los cocos, además en el mismo puesto tiene el punto de venta de periódicos y recargas telefónicas.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de cocos y pago de periódicos para revender, esto le ayudara a tener el efectivo para realizar su venta.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio más fuerte, y tambien poseer casa propia.
texts.en: José sells coconuts, newspapers, and cell phone top ups. He lives with his wife in her family's house. He sells his products in the city center. He has a cart which holds the coconuts that he sells, and he sells newspapers and cell phone top ups from the same spot. He is requesting a loan to buy coconuts and newspapers to sell. The loan will help him have enough cash to buy his supplies. His aspirations are to make his business stronger and to have his own house.

loans.use: buy coconuts and newspapers to sell.

loans.name: Alexis Fabian

texts.es:
ALEXIS FABIAN tiene 30 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría.
 
ALEXIS FABIAN se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz desde hace tiempo. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea, líquido mata maleza y pagar a los jornaleros. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras.

Las compras y las ventas las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. El sueño es que mejore el trabajo en los campos. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Alexis Fabian is 30 years old and single, with no children.  He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.

He is a member of VRC Avanza, whose members are in farming and all live in the area of Recinto Agua Frías,  They practically all grew up in the area and mostly they work in the fields of agricultural labor and livestock raising.

Alexis Fabian has worked in farming and growing corn for awhile.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, liquid weed killer, and to pay day laborers.  With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy his fertilizers for the planting season.

He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas, province of Los Ríos.  The challenges that face him are the crop failures and the bad weather.  His dream is for work to get better in the fields.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea, weed killers, and to pay day laborers.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro  de 57 anos de edad, madre soltera con tres hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Ella es  originaria  del departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona  de occidente del País.  Socorro tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general desde hace 31  anos.  Trabajo que lo desempeña de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de socorro es trabajar unas 10 horas diarias ella recurre diariamente una ciudad especifica donde ofrece su mercadería de crédito y contado a clientes fijos y eventuales. Negocio que surgió por la necesidad de tener como subsistir con sus hijos que en aquel momento eran unos niños y dependerían de ella. Socorro ya ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 y ha demostrado en los créditos anteriores su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su mercadería ya que se acerca la temporada navideña donde las ventas se incrementan y de dicha forma poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Con el financiamiento comprar mercadería como: pantalones, faldas, vestidos, ropa de niño, ropa de cama, blusas, cosméticos, sandalias. Socorro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les  brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Socorro is 57 years old. She is a single mother with three grown children who are independent. She is from the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. 

Socorro has been working in general sales for 31 years. She works as a street vendor. Socorro’s daily routine is to work for 10 hours. She goes every day to a specific town where she offers her merchandise on credit and for cash to repeat customers and new ones. She started her business out of necessity so that she could support her children, who at that time were young and depended on her. 

Socorro has worked before with Fundación Leon and through previous loans has shown herself to be responsible and punctual with her repayments. She needs the loan to stock up on merchandise because the Christmas season is approaching, which is when her sales increase. Having stock will allow her to meet her customers’ demands. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise such as: pants, skirts, dresses, children’s clothing, bedding items, blouses, cosmetics, and sandals. 

Socorro is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to people of few resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a dignified way to work.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise such as: pants, blouses, skirts, children’s clothing, bedding items, underwear, cosmetics, and sandals.

loans.name: Yaoska Mercedes

texts.es: Yaoska Mercedes de 29 anos de edad, madre soltera con un hijo de ocho anos tiene por actividad económica el servicio de cyber ubicado en su casa de habitación. Yaoska tiene tres anos de tener el negocio. Ella inicio este negocio porque vio la necesidad de tener una fuente de trabajo y aprovecho ya que por su localidad no había alguien que prestara este servicio, por lo tanto ha sido rentable para ella, y en la actualidad ha mejorado su clientela y sus ingresos. Yaoska se caracteriza por ser  una mujer y madre responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de su hijo para que tenga un futuro mejor. La rutina diaria de Yaoska es trabajar unas 12 horas para brindar mejor servicio a su clientela y obtener mejores ganancias. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar papelería y dar mantenimiento a las maquinas. Yaoska Mercedes agradece la  ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Yaoska Mercedes is twenty-nine years old, and is a single mother of one eight-year-old boy.  She operates an internet cafe in the home where she lives.  She has been in this business for three years.  She started in this business because she saw the need to have a work source, and so she took advantage of the fact that there wasn't anyone in her area who offered this service.  Therefore, her business has been profitable and presently, she has increased her customer base and income.

Yaoska categorizes herself as a responsible woman and mother that worries about the well-being of her son and him having a better future.  The daily routine of Yaoska is to work for twelve hours in order to offer the best service to her customers and to gain better profits.  The financing she needs is to invest in working capital, to buy paper, and to maintain the computers.  

Yaoska Mercedes is thankful for the help of the investors at Kiva who offer services to individuals with scarce resources in poor countries, like in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital, to buy paper, and to maintain the computers.

loans.name: Yiskeila

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 10,600 pesos Yiskeila podrá comprar shampoo, acondicionador, productos para el cuidado del pelo y ropa interior femenina para sus clientes. Ella decidió iniciar en este negocio cuando nació su niño, que ahora tiene 5 años. Es madre soltera y conocedora de que no tendría apoyo para criar a su hijo, tomó la decisión de abrir un salón de belleza propio, pues había trabajado hasta la fecha como empleada. 
Su niño está en Kinder y en las tardes ella tiene la oportunidad de estar con el y ayudarlo con sus tareas, pues el Salón de Belleza opera desde la casa.
Yiskeila desea ahorrar para comprar un solar donde iniciar poco a poco la cosntrucción de su casa propia.
texts.en:
With a loan of 10,600 pesos, Yiskella will be able to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair-care products, and women's underwear for her customers. She decided to begin this business when her son was born, and he is now 5 years old. She is a single mother, and knowing that she would not have support to raise her son, she decided to open her own beauty salon, since she had worked up until then as an employee. 

Her son is in kindergarten, and in the afternoons she has the opportunity to be with him and help him with his homework, since the beauty salon operates from her house. Yiskella wants to save to buy a plot of land where she will begin, little by little, the construction of her own house.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, hair-care products, and women's underwear for her customers

loans.name: Alexi

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos podré comprar blusas, camisas, pantalones, zapatos y ropa interior femenina para su tienda.

Alexi abrió su tienda hace 14 meses, cuando perdió su empleo. Su esposa trabaja como prestadora de servicios domésticos. Ambos tienen 4 hijos entre 15 y 7 años, quienes asisten a la escuela de la comuniad .

"He tomado este préstamo porque quiero ampliar la variedad de mercancía que ofrezco a mis clientes, para así alcanzar a una mayor cantidad de clientes y tener un mayor crecimiento en mi negocio", comenta Alexi.
texts.en:
With a loan of 26,250 pesos, Alexi will be able to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shoes, and women's underwear for his store. 

Alexi opened his store 14 months ago, when he lost his job. His wife works as a provider of domestic services. They have four children between the ages of 15 and 7, who attend the school in the community.

"I am taking out this loan because I want to expand the variety of merchandise that I offer my customers, so that this way I can reach a larger number of customers and have bigger growth in my business," comments Alexi.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, shoes, and women's underwear for his store.

loans.name: Gnessouma Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe   GNESSOUMA   sont essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  KADIA  fait le commerce  des pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes de    GNESSOUMA    elle se tient en troisième position de la droite vers la gauche. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt environs 5 pièces de pagne qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The six members of the Gnessouma group are mainly married women with an average age of 35, and have an average of three children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a popular neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and aim to satisfy their customers' requests. 

Kadia works selling pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using traditional wax methods, and is pictured third from right to left. She plans to buy about five lengths of pagne with her loan, which she will resell on a cash basis on site and from home, to a clientele mainly comprised of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 37,500 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [traditional wrap-around cloth]

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru: Зафарджону 20 лет. Он студент 4 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета по специальности Мировая экономика. Он очень трудолюбивый и успешный студент. В свободное время он увлекается спортом и компьютерными играми. Его отец врач, а мать занимается скотоводством. Доход его родителей не позволяет оплатить за его учебу в университете. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zafarjon is 20 years old.  He is a fourth-year student of the Tajikistan State University with a major in world economy.  He is a very hardworking and successful student.  He plays sports and computer games in his free time.  His father is a doctor, and mother is involved in animal husbandry.  His parents' income does not allow to pay for his education at the university.  Zafarjon is requesting this loan to pay for his education.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his university education

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo, tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de verduras para obtener ingresos y mantener su hogar, tambien vende productos de belleza, tiene tres años de vender y fue por iniciativa propia instalar el negocio.
Ella quiere invertir en el negocio de las verduras, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar verduras frescas como yuca, repollo, güisquiles, papas, esto incrementara su inventario y que sus clientes encuentren producto de calidad, en el negocio de productos de belleza no invertirá por el momento, debido a que tiene suficiente mercaderia, solo se destinará este prestamo al de verduras.
La aspiración de Ana es que su negocio mejore económicamente para tener más capacidad para atender a los clientes y así ofrecer una vida mejor a su familia (en la foto se muestra con el negocio de productos de belleza).
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and they have three adult children.  She sells vegetables as well as beauty products to earn an income and maintain the household.  She has been in business for three years and started it on her own initiative.

In order to invest in her business of selling vegetables, she is requesting a loan to buy fresh vegetables such as yucca plant, cabbage, squash and potatoes.  This will increase her inventory and make available quality products to her customers.

Ana's goal is to improve her business economically and have more capacity to serve her customers.  This will allow her to improve her family's lifestyle.

(in this photo she is pictured with the beauty product business)

loans.use: To buy yucca plant, cabbage, squash, and potatoes.

loans.name: Odai

texts.en:
Odai is a single, young Palestinian man.  His mother is a housewife and his father is employed but earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.
Odai is preparing to open a Barber shop.  He has acquired the essential skills to do this work by receiving training for this career.
Odai is requesting a 3000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a required barber kit, which is necessary to start his career. This will enable Odai to start his project in the right way, gain the satisfaction of the clients and achieve success, which will ensure to him bright future.
Odai is photographed in his shop.

loans.use: to buy new barber kit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for buying more items, like clothes.

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  BALIMAYA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme Wassa  fait le commerce  des agrumes dans ce groupe de femmes de   BALIMAYA   elle se tient au milieu. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 15 paniers d’orange qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The five members of the Balimaya group are married women with an average age of 39, and have an average of three children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, a popular neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and aim to satisfy their customers' requests. 

Wassa works selling citrus fruits, and is pictured standing in the middle of the rest of the Balimaya group members. She plans to buy 15 baskets of oranges with her loan, which she will resell on a cash basis on site and from home, to a clientele mainly comprised of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 26,500 francs CFA, part of which will be used to repay her loan and the rest will be saved. Wassa plans to increase her sales so that she can better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruits.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 40 years old. She lives in the Telavi District of East Georgia, with her husband George, a 20-year-old son and her mother-in-law. Ekaterine’s son is a student and George works as an artisan locally to earn monthly income. Ekaterine works as a saleslady and she gets a small monthly salary as well. The family income is only enough to cover food and everyday expenses.  Ekaterine has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was always rejected, due to low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved under a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with easier conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit, Ekaterine will purchase children’s clothing and sell it from the store located at the local fair. She will begin her entrepreneurial activity with a wide assortment of merchandise and high sales volume.   This will increase the family's income. She wants to develop her business further and reinvest the increased income in trading. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family. She is grateful in advance for your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for starting trading business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Gormah

texts.en: Gormah is 32 years old and lives in Kakata.  She is single and did not attend school.  She has three children ages 4 to 11 that are in school and live at home. For the past three years she has been selling palm oil in the local market, she makes a lot of profit because she sells quality palm oil and has a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She hopes to build a house and buy land in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is an active woman who is dedicated to her work and has many goals that she wants to accomplish. Every day she strives to work persistently and lovingly because she knows that that is what it takes to achieve the success she desires.  Luvuno says that the previous loan had a great impact on the welfare of her family.

Demand increased during the last sales month, so she wants to take advantage of this trend by making a new investment. For this reason, she is requesting a new loan to buy more goats, for her newly established goat meat business.

loans.use: to buy more more goats.

loans.name: Abdulhafith

texts.en: Abdulhafith is 30 years old and a hardworking man. He got married last July and is now supporting his new family by working in his car repair shop. Abdulhafith is a mechanic who has been in business for over six years. He has applied to this youth loan to buy new spare pieces for repairing cars and buy new tools for the workshop.

loans.use: to buy new spare pieces for repairing cars and buy new tools.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es: El  banco comunal el Triunfo está conformado por 8 integrantes, todas personas adultas, casadas, con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Personas muy luchadoras, trabajadoras, con ganas de bríndales mejores oportunidades a sus hijos para que tenga un futuro mejor. Estos integrantes decidieron optar a la modalidad de banco comunal para optar al crédito y ayudarse mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas. El banco comunal es originario de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona occidente de país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por ser una zona agrícola donde la siembra es su mayor actividad como maíz, plátanos.  Graciela Ramona es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga del buen funcionamiento y la responsabilidad del mismo en cuanto a sus pagos. Graciela tiene por actividad económica la venta de plátanos en su casa y de forma ambulante. La rutina de Graciela es salir a vender en su comunidad en un carretón los plátanos diariamente unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El banco comunal  el Triunfo agradece la ayuda que le brindan los inversionistas kiva a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Triunfo" [The Triumph] is made up of eight members.  All of the members are adults, married, and together they have fifteen children they are responsible for.  They are fighting, hard-working individuals with the desire to offer the best opportunities for their children so that they have a better future. 

These members decided to select a communal bank model to qualify for loans and mutually help one another in their different economic activities.  The communal bank was formed in Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the western part of the country.  Malpaisillo is characterized as being an agricultural area where growing crops, like corn and bananas, is the main activity.  

Graciela Ramona is the coordinator of the bank and is responsible for the smooth operation of the bank, in addition to paying her own installments.  Graciela sells bananas from her house and also travels to customers' homes to sell.  Graciela's routine is to leave to sell in the community with her small cart of bananas.  For ten hours every day, she offers her products to her regular clients and to potential new customers.  

The communal bank El Triunfo is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to them and to other people with scarce resources in poor countries, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: To invest in working capital and to purchase plantains to sell door to door

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
MARIO ENRIQUE tiene 37 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo de 1 año, vive con la conyugue y el hijo en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

MARIO ENRIQUE  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir creciendo con los cultivos.  
 
Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la falta de dinero. El sueño es tener casa propia y terrenoas. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Mario Enrique, age 37, is in a common-law marriage and has a one year old child.  He lives with his wife and child in the city of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the Avanza communal bank.  The members are farmers, and they all live in the Agua Frías precinct.  Virtually all of them were raised in this area.  They mainly work in agriculture or with livestock.  

Mario Enrique grows corn and raises chickens and pigs.  He is requesting the loan to buy supplies, urea, liquid weed killer, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan he will be able to continue growing his crops.  He will make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The challenge he faces is the lack of money.

His dream is to have his own house and his own fields.  In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, urea, liquid weed killer, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es: Anselmo de 47 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y es padre de un hijo de 16 años. Él tiene un almacén de repuestos para motocicletas y también ofrece en su taller el servicio de reparación de estos vehículos. Su negocio data desde hace 6 años, cuando empezaron a proliferar las motocicletas como  el sistema de transporte popular y con ello la necesidad de hacer mantenimiento preventivo, actualizar los vehículos, repararlos y conseguir repuestos. Lo primero que hizo antes de iniciar su negocio fue contar el número de motocicletas que pasaban por el lugar y el número de  proveedores de repuestos de su alrededor y percibió que el punto de ventas era funcionar y decidió asesorarse de su sobrino quien conocía el tema. Así fue como inició en un local familiar y poco a poco fueron aumentando sus clientes, hasta ser reconocido en el sector como hoy lo ha logrado, allí vende frenos, guayas, correas Stop, líquidos para frenos, cadenas, bombillos entre otros. En la actualidad está aplicando a un segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el primero logró comprar un mayor volumen de repuestos e incrementar sus ventas con nuevo inventario de artículos. Hoy con su credikiva lo invertirá en la compra de llantas de motocicletas en un mayor volumen, que es el repuesto de mayor rotación en su negocio y con ello aumentará una vez mas el volumen de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Anselmo is 47 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla and he is the father of a child who is 16 years old.  He has a repair shop for motorcycles and he also offers his services to repair these vehicles.  His shop has been in business for the past 6 years, when motorcycles began to become more popular as a common means of transportation, and thus created a need for preventative maintenance, upgrade vehicles, make repairs, and find parts.

The first things he did when he opened his business was to count the number of motorcycles that passed by his location and the number of other repair shops around him, and he perceived that the point of a shop was to work well and decided to get advice from his nephew, who knew a lot about the subject.  That's how he began his family business, and little by little, he has grown his customer base, so that he is now known throughout the area.  He sells brakes, tubing, Stop brand belts, brake fluid, chains, bulbs, and more.

He is currently applying for his second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the first, he was able to buy a larger number of parts and grow his business through a new inventory selection.  With his current micro-loan, he will invest in buying tires for the motorcycles in bulk quantities, since this is the part in greatest demand in his business, and with these he will be able to increase once more the volume of his sales.

loans.use: to buy tires for motorcycles.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de 50 años de edad desde las 8  de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde está dedicada a su negocio de venta de mercancías variadas como electrodomésticos menores, calzado, ropa, bolsos y artículos de fantasía, que vende a su clientela de contado y a créditos de corto plazo, de acuerdo a cada cliente.  Su actividad comercial inició hace 15 años, cuando una amiga le propuso vender a crédito e inició con mucha precaución; de esta manera fue ampliando su mercado y poco a poco ha crecido, haciendo negociaciones con diversos proveedores y mediante guías especializadas de productos, mediante las cuales promociona la mercancía que ofrece. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior logró aumentar su ingreso y hoy con su credikiva, planea seguir creciendo, por eso   comprará calzado para damas, caballeros e infantil, ropa elegante, que en la actividad de preventa han solicitado sus clientes, a propósito de las fiestas de fin de año, donde todos tienen dinero para vestirse elegante y esperar el año nuevo en familia.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old and from 8 in the morning until 6 every night, she works in her variety shop selling kitchen appliances, footwear, clothing, bags, and jewelry, which she sells to her customers via cash purchase or short term loans, depending on the customer.  Her business was started about 15 years ago, when a friend asked if she would like to sell goods on credit, and she began with great caution.  From this start, she has been increasing her market and she has grown the business little by little, negotiating with a variety of distributors and working via specialty catalogs, though which she promotes the merchandise that she offers.

She is currently applying for a micro-loan, her second financial assistance from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With the former, she was able to increase her total income, and today she plans to continue growing her business, and therefore she will buy footwear for women, men, and children and fancy clothes, which she has been asked to provide by her customers in her pre-ordering business to have for their New Years' parties, where everyone has the money to dress themselves up elegantly and wait for the New Year together with their families.

loans.use: to buy footwear for women, men and children, and dress clothing.

loans.name: Daycis Del Socorro

texts.es: Daycis tiene  37 años  de edad, casada, originaria de de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 4, 12 y 17 años de edad respectivamente. Se dedica a la venta de pollo fresco. Daycis agradece   a Kiva y MiCrédito por el apoyo brindado, pues el préstamo fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo invertirlo en su negocio, además con las ganancias que obtuvo logro incrementar las ventas. En esta ocasión  requiere el financiamiento comprar pollo, pechugas y menudos para poder incrementar el volumen de las ventas sobre en esta época de navidad cuando más aumenta la demanda, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio activo para poder sostener su familia
texts.en:
Daycis is 37 years old, married, and originally from Estelí.  She is a merchant and the mother of three children (ages 4, 12, and 17 respectively).  Daycis sells fresh chicken.  

She is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito for the support they have provided.  This loan will be a great help because she will be able to invest in her business.  In addition, the profit she earns will enable her to increase her sales.  

On this occasion, she needs a loan so that she can buy whole chickens, breasts, and giblets in order to increase her sales volume.  During the Christmas season, there is greater demand.  Her future plans include maintaining an active business so that she can support her family.

loans.use: to buy whole chickens and various chicken parts.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo, solicita un préstamo porque necesita fortalecer el negocio, con más variedad de productos para la temporada, se comprara ropa variada para todas las edades, que le permita atender  a sus clientes.
El ha Utilizado varios prestamos, el efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue la ayuda a mejorar el negocio, del cual logro ayudar a su familia con las ganancias que ha recibido, en su hogar todas las condiciones se mantienen.
texts.en: Rodolfo requests a loan because he needs to make his business stronger, with more variety of seasonal products; he will buy various types of clothing for all ages which will allow him to serve his clients.  The result he obtained with his previous loans helped improve the business and he was able to help his family with the profits, his home conditions are the same.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothing.

loans.name: Agueda Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Agueda tiene 26 años, es soltera,  ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  es promotora de productos de belleza ella vende de manera ambulante visitando instituciones públicas y privadas, barrios distintos domicilios ofreciendo sus productos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Agueda va a usar este préstamo  para comprar cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción para tener en stock para su  negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es tener variedad de productos para  satisfacer a sus  clientes, la Sra. Agueda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son atender  con eficiencia a sus clientes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y salir adelante  sola.
texts.en:
Agueda is 26 years old and single, and she is in the business of selling cosmetics via catalog.  She is a beauty product representative, which she sells via foot sales by visiting public and private institutions, neighborhoods, and different households to offer her products.  This loan is her first within the organization.  

Agueda will use her loan funds to buy cosmetics that she finds on sale to add to the stock for her business, and her reason for asking for this loan is to have a variety of products to satisfy her customers.  Agueda has challenges in her line of work, which include waiting on her customers efficiently, and she plans to use the profits from her business to improve the quality of life for her family, since this is her only means of covering her expenses and getting ahead by herself.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнура 39 года, разведена, имеет дочь 9 лет. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Айнура  начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 20,000 сом (KGS) 10 лет назад хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Айнура , ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура  обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобыл. Доходы Айнура  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение бизнес за счет увеличения поголовья скота. В её планах в будущем покупка мебели для дома.
texts.en:
Ainura is 39 years old, divorced, and has a 9-year-old daughter. As a main source of income for the family, Ainura began to engage in raising livestock. Started with 20,000 som (KGS), ten years later the farm now receives around 10,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products. 

Thanks to her hard work, Ainura's farm now consists of four dairy cows and one horse. With the goal of further developing her business, Ainura  appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 115,000 som (KGS) to buy mares. 

Ainura plans to use income to invest in a further growth in business by increasing the number of livestock. She plans in the future to purchase furniture for her home.

loans.use: to purchase horses

loans.name: Asbubu

texts.ru: Асбубу 63 года, вдова. Асбубу в качестве основного дохода начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Асбубу в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 3  коровы, 11 овец и коз. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 5,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Асбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Асбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. В дальнейшем она планирует отремонтировать дом и купить хороший телевизор.
texts.en:
Asbubu is a 63-year-old widow. As a main source of income, Asbubu started raising livestock and vegetables, beginning with a sum of 5,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Asbubu today has on her farm three cows, 11 sheep and goats. Her monthly income from the business is about 5,000 som. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Asbubu appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening and resale. Asbubu plans to use proceeds from the loan to further augment the number of livestock. In the future, she plans to do home renovations and to buy a good television.

loans.use: to purchase calves and sheep

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 44 years old, married to Evaline and has been blessed with five children that he supports. He is a livestock farmer and has been in livestock farming for the last three years earning a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

He is servicing his first loan of KES 86,300 from KADET LTD that he plans to purchase more livestock for fattening and resale, especially sheep and goats. 

He intends to use the anticipated profits to purchase a motorbike for business diversification. His future dream is to prosper and improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos es un trabajador de una procesadora de piña. El desea poder obtener un prestamo por quinientos mil colones exactos (¢500.000) con el fin de comprara una motocicleta para poder transportarse a su trabajo. para el es de gran importancia este prestamo ya que le ayudara con las necesidades de transporte diario.
texts.en: Carlos is a worker in a pineapple processing facility.  He hopes to obtain a loan of exactly 500,000 Colones with the aim of buying a motorcycle to get himself to work.  For him, it is very important to get this loan, since it will help him with his daily transportation needs.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Vita

texts.ru:
Вита живет в Новой Каховке. Она уже 8 лет занимается фермерским хозяйством, выращивая ранние и поздние огурцы в тепличных условиях на собственном участке в 45 соток. 
Вита обратилась в КИВА за кредитом с целью построить еще одну дополнительную теплицу, расширить хозяйство, получить дополнительный доход с продажи ранних огурцов и заработать на нужды семьи и бизнеса.
texts.en:
Vita lives in Novaya Kahovka. She has eight years of experience in farm management, growing early and late cucumbers in greenhouses on her own 45-acre plot of land. 
 
Vita appealed to Kiva for a loan in order to build one additional greenhouse, expand facilities, and receive additional revenue from the sale of early cucumbers and to earn for the needs of the family and business.

loans.use: to build one additional greenhouse

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина работает в сфере торговли одеждой, реализуя трикотажную одежду на одном из местных рынков Новой Каховки. У нее – собственный бутик, землю арендует у администрации рынка – это всегда дополнительные расходы в бизнесе. В этой сфере Валентина работает уже 17 лет. 
Валентина запланировала закупку осенней трикотажной одежды, а именно кофт, свитеров, юбок и костюмов на сумму в 10 000 гривен.
texts.en:
Valentina works in the clothing trade, selling knitted clothing in one of the local markets of Novaya Kahovka. She has her own boutique kiosk and leases land from the market administration -- this is always an additional cost of business. Valentina has been working in this area for 17 years.
 
Valentina plans to buy autumn knitted clothing, namely jackets, sweaters, skirts, and dresses for the sum of 10,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to buy autumn knitted clothing

loans.name: Jarmah

texts.en:
Jarmah, age 40, earns an income by selling used clothing at the local market. She has been engaged in this venture for 15 years. She started her business with savings from her previous business, which was fish vending. 

She and her husband live in Kakata Town and have six children between the ages of 11 and 22 years old. The three youngest are enrolled in school and live at home, while the three eldest are living on their own.

Jarmah enjoys her work because she is relaxed and her business is going well. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more used clothes to offer for sale. She plans to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 49 years old and lives in the town of Kakata. She is married, and her husband is a government worker. They have eight children, ages 9 to 30. Four of them live on their own, and the youngest one is a stay-at-home parent and attends school. For the past twenty years, Ruth has been making and selling local soap in the local market. Sometimes she buys caustic and oil at a very high price, and she realizes a very low profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase caustic and oil for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase caustic and oil for her business.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей 20 лет занимается тепличным хозяйством, выращивает ранние и поздние огурцы и помидоры на собственном участке в 50 соток. 
Сергей обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 14 000 гривен для того, чтобы построить новую теплицу для предстоящего сезона. Сергей очень любит заниматься сельским хозяйством, он любит вкладывать силы и время в свое дело и стремится по возможности расширять тепличное хозяйство.
texts.en:
Sergei has been working with greenhouse farming for 20 years, growing early and late cucumbers and tomatoes on his own plot of 50 acres. 

Sergei turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 14,000 hryvnia in order to build a new greenhouse for the upcoming season. Sergei enjoys farming very much. He likes to invest time and energy in his work and strives for possibilities to expand his greenhouse farm.

loans.use: to build a new greenhouse for the upcoming season

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a forty four-year-old married woman living in Hoima, Uganda. She is a business woman dealing in the saloon business and also gets additional income from rental houses. Her initial capital was provided by her husband, and she has progressively managed it to the present day. She has ambitions of expanding her business to new areas to be able to educate her children up to University level. Janet intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business so as to supplement her income from the saloon and rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more threads and some tailoring tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 44 years old and married with six children.

Mercelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Mercelita has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

Mercelita aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a 30-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda.

He is in the transport business and specifically drives a taxi. Due to the poor transport policies, he faces the challenges of a poor road network and high license fees. Like most good fathers, his dream is to educate his children so they can attain degrees and set up sustainable income generating activities for themselves. 

Yasin intends to use the loan to buy spare parts for his taxi which broke down.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his taxi which broke down.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca, 48, lives in West Point. She is a widow with five children who are between the ages of 21 and 32. Four of her children live outside the home and are independent. Only one of the children stays with her at home and is currently in school. 

For the past eight years, she has been selling vita, palm oil, onions, rice, peppers, and cooking oil at the community market. She started in this business with the amount that she has been saving with a saving club. She makes a profit when she sells food. With the profit, she buys more goods to improve her business, and then she repays the loan. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more vita, palm oil, onion, rice, and salt for the business. She hopes to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, onions, rice, and salt for the business

loans.name: Addy

texts.en:
Addy is a male and is 46 years old. He is married with four children, all are in school.

He has a seed nursery and a primary school which helps orphans to access an education at subsidized rates. He started in 2010 with eight pupils, but now he has a population of 150 pupils. He works there every school day since he also assists in teaching.

He is borrowing money to finish some semi-permanent structures at the school to reduce the risk of studying under the tree shade. This will help him meet the students' education needs since the government primary schools are far a distance of over 20 kilometers.

Addy’s clients are the children from his neighboring community.

He says that in the future he wants to develop the school from where it is now, up to seven classes so that he can transform his society through education. Also if he gets those to buy books for the pupils since its one of his major challenges because they are expensive.

His major challenge is that he lacks funds to pay teachers who keep going away and this disrupts studying.

He is an honest and hardworking person who, if given support, can transform his society.

loans.use: to finish an incomplete school building

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad (rickshaw) transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store business. Maria is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (rickshaw)

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enhtaivan is 52 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ger in Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Davaasuren, 48, works at a private cashmere company. 

His two children, Zolbayar and Uyanga, ages 22 and 24 graduated from university and are now helping him build an energy efficient house for the family to use. 

His youngest son Bayartsog, age 18, is a university student. He works at the Special Training School for Vision Impaired people as a felt production teacher. 

Mr. Enhtaivan has started building an energy efficient house for his family to use and now he is requesting a 6'000'000MNT loan to finish building an energy efficient house for his family to use before the harsh and cold Mongolian winter comes. 

He is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person who says, "I have to make my children be able to live by themselves for their future."

loans.use: to finish building an energy efficient house for his family to use before the harsh and cold Mongolian winter comes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 43 years old and is married with four children.

Mercedes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mercedes has been in this business for four years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Mercedes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yana

texts.ru:
Яне – 24 года. Она работает бухгалтером в городской типографии Новой Каховки. Яна совсем недавно вышла замуж, с мужем переехали в собственную квартиру. Квартира давно нуждалась в ремонте, но молодой семье постоянно не хватало необходимых средств для этого. 
Яна обратилась в КИВА за суммой в размере 8 000 гривен для личных целей. У нее не хватало собственных средств, чтобы заменить 3 окна и подоконники в квартире, а также установить балконный блок. После того, как наступили холода, и в квартирах стало ощутимее прохладно, эта нужда стала насущнее для всей семьи Яны. Поэтому она решила больше не откладывать и воспользоваться кредитными услугами КИВА, тем самым облегчив жизнь своей семьи и создав уют в доме.
texts.en:
Yana is 24 years old. She works as an accountant at a publishing house in the city of Novaya Kahovka. Yana got married not long ago, and she and her husband moved to their own apartment. The apartment has been in need of repair for a long time, but the young family has not had the necessary funds to repair it. 

Yana turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 8,000 hryvnia for personal purposes. She did not have enough money of her own to change three windows and windowsills in the apartment, and further to set up a balcony. After the cold came, and the apartment became significantly colder, this need became more pressing for the whole of Yana's family. Therefore she decided to stop postponing the repair and make use of Kiva's financial services, and thereby making the family's life easier and create comfort in the house.

loans.use: to change three windows and windowsills in her apartment, and further set up a balcony

loans.name: Yulia

texts.ru:
Юлия живет и ведет свой бизнес в Новой Каховке. Она арендует торговую площадь у администрации местного торгового центра, реализуя стильную женскую одежду. Юлия занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет. Самым ходовым товаром у нее являются футболки, кофты, юбки, свитера и брюки. 
Юлия запланировала закупку осенней одежды, а именно кофт, свитеров, юбок, брюк и прочего для последующей реализации у себя на точке. Для этого ей необходима сумма в размере 4 000 гривен, за которой она и обратилась в КИВА.
texts.en:
Yulia lives and runs her business in Novaya Kahovka. She rents a retail space from the administration of a local shopping center, selling stylish women's clothing. Yulia has been in this business for 7 years already. Her most popular goods are t-shirts, jackets, skirts, sweaters and pants. 

Yulia has planned to purchase fall clothes, namely jackets, sweaters, skirts, pants and other things for selling in her store. For this she needs a loan in the amount of 4,000 hryvnia, for which she has turned to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase autumn clothes for selling

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a 37-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 2 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be social and friendly. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a competitive market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her eight family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. Previously, Roseline had taken a loan of KES 20,000 which she managed to pay back.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en: Albertha lives at Paynesville South. She is 39 years old, married and has three children that are between the ages of 3 and 18 and attend school. Albertha has been involved in used clothing sales for the past six years. She sells both boys and girls clothing. She learned to sell from her mother and received the initial capital from her husband to start this business. With the profit generated from the business, she will buy more goods for the business and contribute to the expenditures of the family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for the business. Her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for the business.

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en:
Mrs. Jargalsaihan, age 38 and widowed, is a part-time worker at World Vision International and also manages a dairy farm located at her father's home. On the farm, she produces organic dairy products and supplies these to local schools and other organizations. She is a sophisticated, hard-working, and caring person.

Mrs. Jargalsaihan lives with her three children in an apartment in the Niseh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her son Olzii-Jargal, age 15, studies food technology at college. Her other children, Buyan-Olzii and Buyanjargal, ages eight and 11, attend primary and secondary schools. 

She has already built up a strong supply chain and she delivers dairy products on a daily basis to her customers. She needs transportation in order to make her business efficient and more profitable. For this reason, she requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 MNT in order to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas hybrid car, which she will use to deliver her organic dairy products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly hybrid car, which she will use to deliver her organic dairy products to her customers

loans.name: Adeebah

texts.en:
Adeeba is a tailor and a previous Kiva borrower. She applied for her previous loan in order to buy fabric and thread to increase her production. However, one of her sewing machines broke down unexpectedly, so she had to postpone buying the required fabric and paid for the machine to be repaired instead. 

Now that the machine is functional again, Adeeba has applied for another loan in order to obtain more fabric and thread for making military and civil clothes to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina earns an income by operating a café. There are many people who wish to improve themselves, and one of them is this woman. Through her efforts, she has managed to position herself in the market and achieve what she has to date. She is very hard-working, positive, and enterprising.

Amina's café has brought her a good income. She now needs to make new investments through the purchase of essential ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, and cooking oil. 

She hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy essential ingredients like wheat flour, vegetables, and cooking oil

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old and he is from Gaza. He owns a shop where he has been selling mobile phones since 2009. He asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy maintenance elecronics and more mobiles for his shop. He hopes that this loan will help him improve increase selling and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy maintenance electronics and more mobiles for his shop.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher  is a 40-year-old married man. He has seven children who range in age from two years to 17 years old. He describes himself to be social and customer friendly. He operates a food stall where he sells cereals, such as maize, beans, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a competitive business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 21,000 loan to purchase a water tank, which will be used by his nine family members for household activities. His business goal is to run a big cereal store business selling a variety of cereals within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Previously, he took a loan of 80,000 which he paid well. In addition, Christopher has a motorcyle which increases his business income.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Zuhriya

texts.en: Zuhriya is 41 years old and an independent woman. She is a mother of three daughters and a son; her husband is a baker. She wakes up early in the morning and uses her car as private transportation for the neighborhood children to send them to their school and some young ladies to their colleges, and the same by the end of the day. During the day, she buys women's dresses called Abaya at wholesale prices and sells them at home at a reasonable price. Now she has applied for this loan to increase the quantity she has of Abaya to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity she has of Abaya (women's dresses).

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is a trader and a previous Kiva borrower. He is still successfully running his trading business, which allows him to provide for his family. Gagik reports that his son now works as a builder, which means that Gagik is managing his business on his own, without assistance. 

Gagik has expanded his business to include the sale of fresh fish. He says that this was a very good idea, as fish is in great favor in any season.   

Gagik utilized his first Kiva loan to increase his stall assortment. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 450.000 AMD in order to buy a large supply of citrus, nuts, and fish to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of citrus, nuts, and fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Marlon Omar

texts.es:
Marlon, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 14, 12 y 3 años, su actividad u oficio es la de pescador, esto lo aprendió de su familia, trabaja realizando la pesca cinco días a la semana.
Solicita  un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la pesca como red, plomo, bayas e hilo, estos materiales los utilizara para realizar la pesca, el préstamo será un gran aporte para que adquiera los materiales necesarios.
Los sueños de Marlon es comprarse una lancha con motor, en la cual pueda mejorar su negocio y las oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en: Marlon lives with his family; he has three children whose ages are 14, 12 and 3 years.  His activity or occupation is fishing; he learned it from his family.  He works fishing five days a week.  He requests the loan to buy fishing supplies like nets, weights, poles and fishing line.  He will use these supplies to fish.  The loan is a great help for him to get the things he needs.  Marlon’s dream is to buy a motorized boat to improve his business and growth opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies like netting, weights, poles and fishing line.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Yesenia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas vive con su familia, tres hijos y su esposo, ella y su esposo trabajan por el mantenimiento de su familia, Yesenia realiza las ventas de tortillas desde las 6:00am hasta las 2:00pm, desde enero del 2012, se decidió a vender para poder generar una fuente de ingresos a su familia, la ventaja que tiene potencial en el mercado, con clientes de comedores que diariamente tiene un encargo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz, que son los materiales para continuar el negocio, esto ayudara a mejorar el estado del negocio, teniendo más capacidad para satisfacer a los clientes.
Su objetivo es poseer un negocio de tortillas con su propio local, teniendo clientes potenciales, expandirse al centro de la ciudad.
texts.en: Yesenia sells tortillas and lives with her family, her three children, and her husband. Both her and her husband work to support the family. Yesenia has been working selling tortillas from 6am to 2pm since January 2012. She decided to start selling tortillas to have another source of income for her family. Her business has market potential because restaurants place orders with her every day. She is requesting a loan to buy firewood and corn, which are the supplies she needs to keep her business going. With these supplies she will be able to improve the business because she will be more capable of satisfying her customers' demands. Her aim is to have her own premises and run her tortilla business from there and, once she has more customers, expand to the city center.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is 42 years old and married with two children. Roberta works very hard to provide for them.

Roberta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Roberta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries. 

In the future, Roberta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en: Adham is a 23-year-old single guy living with his seven siblings. Adham is a Geology student who goes to one of the Jordanian universities in the north. To make good use of his break times between lectures and afterwards, he applied to work in one of the university’s cafes and was accepted. He uses the money he makes to pay for a part of his semester fees and his daily expenses of food, transportation, telephone points, etc. Now Adham has applied to this loan as he faced some shortages in money to pay for semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the semester fees.

loans.name: Beatrice Laure
