texts.fr: Béatrice laure est un jeune camerounaise de 26 ans qui possède et gère une mini boutique de ventes de vêtements dans un quartier de la ville de puis 3 ans. Elle y vend des habits et chaussures. Dynamique et travailleuse, elle a une clientèle grandissante et elle voudrait tous les satisfaire. ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter des chaussures, pantalons, juppes, chemises, robes, chemissettes etc pour renforcer son stock de marchandises et de ce pas, augmenter ses profits. Les revenus générés seront reinvestis dans son activté et subviendront à ces besoins et ceux de sa maman qui n'est plus en activité.
texts.en:
Béatrice Laure, age 26, is a young woman from Cameroon who owns and manages a very small shop in one of her city's neighborhoods.  She has been selling clothes and shoes for the past three years. 

Dynamic and hardworking,  Béatrice Laure has attracted an increasing number of customers and she would like to be able to satisfy all of their needs.  This loan will allow her to buy shoes, pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, blouses etc. and will boost her inventory and increase their profits.

The profits from this loan will be reinvested in her business and also used to meet her own needs as well as those of her mother who is no longer working.

loans.use: to buy shoes, pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, blouses etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 43 years old and married with four children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like detergent, soap, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Susana has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Susana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like detergent, soap, soft drinks, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jacestine

texts.en:
Jacestine is 29 years old, married and blessed with four children whom she supports. She has operated a food stall in Bomet market for the past eight years. 

Her monthly income is KES 6,000 and with first loan of KES 15,000 from KADET LTD, she intends to buy more cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour for use in the business.

The anticipated profits will be used to support the business. Her future dream is to have a stable business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to pay for food supplies for her business.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en: Haytham is a 22-year-old single guy and the oldest brother among his five siblings. Haytham is now in his last year studying Anthropology in a governmental university in northern Jordan. Every day after school, Haytham goes to work in a café near the university, mostly in the evenings, to be able to pay for university. Haytham has applied to this loan because he was not able to work enough to get paid as usual. He had to apply asking for a loan to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's fees.

loans.name: Diogenes Vicente

texts.es:
DIOGENES VICENTE tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los  hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante da la VRC AVANZA sus miembros se dedican a la Agricultura todos viven en el Sector del Recinto Agua Frías, prácticamente se han criado en esa zona, se dedican a Labores agrícolas u pecuarias en su mayoría. 

 DIOGENES VICENTE  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, urea, líquido mata maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir creciendo con los cultivos.   

Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas y el mal clima. 
El sueño es seguir trabajando en la agricultura para prosperar.  En el tiempo libre le gusta ser arbitro de butbol.
texts.en:
Diógenes Vicente, 32, is in  a common-law relationship and has two children.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

He's a member of Avanza Communal Bank.  The members make a living in agriculture, and they all live in the area of Recinto Aguas Frías.  They have practically grown up in that area.  They mostly make a living in farming and livestock.

Diógenes Vicente makes a living in agriculture growing corn.  He also raises chickens and pigs.  He's requesting the loan to buy inputs, urea, liquid weedkiller, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan he'll be able to continue growing with his crops.

He'll make his purchases in the city of Ventanas.  The challenges he faces are pests and bad weather.  His dream is to continue working in agriculture to prosper.  In his free time he likes to be a soccer referee.

loans.use: to buy inputs, urea, liquid weedkiller, and fertilizer

loans.name: Nyumah  S.

texts.en:
Nyumah S., age 47, operates a rice store in his community. He has been engaged in this venture for the past seven years. He and his wife have three children, ages 11, 15, and 17, and the family lives in West Point, Liberia. All three children are enrolled in school and live at home.

Nyumah has lot of customers and makes a good profit. The business flourishes partly because he is the only one in his community who sells good rice by the bag, especially during the rainy season. He utilizes half his profits on house rent and school fees. 

He is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bagged rice for his business. He plans to expand his business and is determined to send his children to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase bagged rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Jader Wadid

texts.es: Jader con su anterior credikiva compró al por mayor y de contado, refrescos, planes de celulares, licores y variedades, con ello su negocio está mucho mas activo y genera mas ingresos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, que invertirá de la misma manera, con ello espera tener una mayor liquidez, aumentar su capital de trabajo e incrementar sus ventas y utilidades. Su inversión tendrá éxito, porque aplicará el capital de crédito a su negocio, en una temporada alta para las ventas, época en la que los licores, los refrescos y variedades son productos exigibles en estanterías comerciales. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Estoy muy agradecida con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con Kiva, espero seguir contando con su apoyo para continuar progresando en mi negocio. “
texts.en: Jader used his previous Kiva loan to pay cash for wholesale purchases of soft-drinks, mobile phone plans, liquor and novelties.  With them, his business is much more active and earns higher income.  He’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan that he will invest in the same way thus having greater liquidity, increased working capital and higher sales and profits.  His investment will be successful because he’ll apply the loan to his business during a season when sales are high; a season when liquor, soft-drinks and novelties are highly sought-after items in sales stands.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following: “I am very grateful to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and to Kiva and hope to continue having your support to continue making progress in my business.”

loans.use: to pay cash and buy soft-drinks, liquor and snacks at wholsale.

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en:
Bahruz, age 30, raises and sells livestock to earn an income. He has been engaged in this business for 10 years. 

He is unmarried and works out of his house, which he owns and which he shares with his parents. His parents teach at the local school. Bahruz learned the livestock trade from his parents and is highly skilled at his work.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,600 AZN in order to purchase furniture for the house in which he and his parents live.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for the house in which he and his parents live

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Glendy Elizabeth

texts.es:
Glendy, administra una panadería de pan casero, tiene 31 años de edad, esta soltera, tiene una hija de 8 años, Glendy vive al lado de sus padres, ella fabrica pan de torta y quesadillas, en un horno lo aprendió de su madre, tiene muchos años de estar realizándolo.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, leña, que le permita mejorar la producción de pan, manteniendo lo necesario a la mano.
La aspiración de ella es que el negocio crezca, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hija ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en: Glendy manages a home-style bread bakery.  She’s 31-years-old, single and has an 8-year-old daughter.  Glendy lives with her parents and makes pound cake and cheese pound cake in an oven; she learned from her mother and has been doing this for many years.  She requests a loan to buy flour, shortening, sugar and firewood to improve bread production by having everything necessary on-hand.  Her hope is that the business grows and as a single mother to provide better quality of life for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy flour, shortening, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.ru:
Надежда живет и работает в Новой Каховке. Она занимается торговлей колготками, гольфами в большом ассортименте, а летом – купальниками и парео. Надежда пока не может позволить себе выкупить землю, на которой находится ее бутик, поэтому ей приходится арендовать землю у администрации рынка, на котором она работает.  
Надежде необходим кредит в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить колготки, гольфы и носки для реализации в холодное время года. Имея достаточный опыт торговли, Надежда знает, что приобретенный ею доступный и ходовой товар быстро реализуется, принеся ей хорошую стабильную прибыль.
texts.en:
Nadezhda lives and works in Novaya Kahovka. She works with selling a large assortment of stockings, knee-highs, and in the summer also swimsuits and wrap-around skirts. Nadezhda does not yet afford to purchase the land on which her point of sales is situated, and therefore she has to rent it from the administration of the market where she works. 

Nadezhda is in need of a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia in order to purchase stockings, knee-highs and socks for selling in the cold time of the year. Having sufficient sales experience, Nadezhda knows that acquiring affordable and popular goods and quickly selling them gives her a good and stable income.

loans.use: to purchase stockings, knee-highs and socks for selling in the cold time of the year

loans.name: Gertrudis De Jesus

texts.es:
Gertrudis, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y venta de gallinas indias, vive con su esposo, tiene un hijo el cual ya tiene su propio hogar, Gertrudis realiza la agricultura desde hace 40 años, la aprendió de su padre, tambien vende gallinas y frutas, pero estas ventas son esporádicas, dependiendo de la temporada, lo realiza desde hace 8 años y lo apredio de unas amistades. 
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas para la ultima cosecha de maíz y frijol, tambien comprara gallinas para la venta, este préstamo contribuirá a finalizar la cosecha de maíz y frijol, se comprara mas gallinas para seguir vendiendo.
Su aspiración es poder mejorar la venta de las gallinas, realizarle mejoras a la vivienda ya que es de adobe y asi poco a poco ir progresando.
texts.en:
Gertrudis works growing corn and selling guinea hens.  She lives with her husband and has a son who has his own home.  Gertrudis has worked in agriculture for 40 years having learned from her father.  She also sells chickens and fruit but these sales are sporadic and seasonal; she’s been doing this for 8 years and learned from some acquaintances.

She’s requesting a loan to buy manure and herbicide for her latest corn and bean crops; she’ll also buy some chickens to sell.  This loan will contribute to finalizing the corn and bean harvests and she’ll buy more chickens to sell.  Her hope is to improve the chicken sales and do some home improvements since it’s adobe and thus gradually make progress.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Tayseer

texts.en: Tayseer, 39, is a hard working man; he is supporting a family of five by selling fluffy candy (cotton candy) on his cart around the neighborhood. Every day, he wakes up early in the morning to make the candy, packs it, and sometimes attaches a small toy with each piece and starts selling in the afternoon until late in the evening. His old machine needs a lot of maintenance. For that, he applied for this loan to fix the current machine until he can afford to buy a new one.

loans.use: to fix the candy machine at his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a business-in-a-box to become a CKW.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 29 years old, married to Nancy, and has been blessed with two children. He operates a dry cleaner and has been running the business for the last five years. His monthly income is KES 20,000.

He is servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and this will assist him to purchase more electrical dry cleaning gadgets, spares, and associated items. 


He plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in and increase his inventory. His future dream is to have a stable business and income that will make him improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to buy dry cleaning equipment

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel  is a 63-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from six to 24 years. He describes himself as being strong and warm. 

He operates a livestock business where he sells livestock such as cows, goats, etc. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an agricultural business area, and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by his seven family members. 

His business goal is to improve his business within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM, after taking a previous one of Kes 50,000 which he managed to pay back successfully.  Samuel plans to complete installing his water tank after eight weeks upon delivery.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives with her husband (in the photo) and two sons in Ashotavan village in the Syuniq region. Besides her work in the local village hall, Armine is also involved in agriculture. She breeds cattle and has 10 cows, 25 chickens, and 10 turkeys. 

Armine also has a little farm where wheat, potatoes, cabbage, and grass are grown. She has applied for the loan to purchase forage for the cattle. The loan is very important for Armine because it will give her the chance to earn more income. 

The loan amount will also be spent on fuel which will help Armine to cut transportation costs and allow her to sell her products to the local market traders.

loans.use: to purchase forage for cattle and fuel.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her husband and three children in the town of Samburu. She is a homemaker and works with her husband in agriculture. With these activities they earn their income. She also sells cereals from her home.

They are requesting a loan to purchase an ox plow and planting materials. They have been farming for over ten years.  With this loan, she can increase their crop production in order to generate more sales to clients. 

Fatuma’s objective is to stay in a job that allows her to help her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an ox plow and planting materials.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, en la siembra de maíz tambien realiza labores de albañilería, vive junto a sus tres hijos, la vivienda es propia, trabaja desde joven, lo aprendió de su padre.
Él esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de abono para aplicarlo al cultivo, este crédito ayudara a que el pueda abonar la milpa y con ello tendrá la posibilidad de mejorar la cosecha. 
Ernesto espera que su cultivo de la temporada se abúndate para poder tener el alimento para el próximo año, tambien quiere que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en: Ernesto works growing basic grains like corn; he also works in construction.  He lives with his three children in a house he owns.  He’s worked since he was young having learned from his father.  He’s asking for a loan to buy manure to apply to his crop.  This loan will help him be able to fertilize his cornfield to have the possibility of an improved harvest.  Ernesto hopes this season’s crop yield will be abundant so that he can have food for the coming year; he’d also like his children to have the opportunity of completing their schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure for his crops.

loans.name: J. Matthew

texts.en:
J. Matthew is 39 years old and lives in West Point. He is married and has two children ages six and 12 respectively. 

He is a high school graduate, and for the past seven years he has been running a shop where he sells rice. He has a lot of customers and his daily sales are very high during the dry season. 

The challenge he faces is the road condition to his shop, especially when he orders his supply, he said. 

His business has enabled him to send his children to school and to buy a piece of land. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for his business, His plans are to expand his business and build a house for his children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice in bags for his business

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tamaraneh” group. They are small scale business women based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve upon their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Isha. Isha is age 40; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is an NGO worker, and one of her children is attending primary school. For more than ten years now, Isha has been selling market food: palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. With the help of this loan, Isha is going to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is a 24-year-old woman from a small village of the Mtskheta district. She lives with her husband, two children (5 and 6 years old), and grandmother who is provided a retirement pension. Her husband works as a daily worker and gets seasonal income. Nino owns a plot of land where she grows different kinds of vegetables. The harvested vegetables are sold locally at a good price. Nino is a very hard working young woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. Nino requested a loan for cultivating a plot of land. After the land is cultivated, she plans to sow wheat and sell the harvested wheat locally. It will increase the income of her family, and thus, they will be able to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to cultivate a plot of land and sow wheat.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en: Arsen is 37 years old and lives in Vedi village of the Ararat region. He has a big family of six: a father, a mother, a wife and two children. The only income of the family comes from agriculture, and it is very difficult for Arsen to sustain the family. Arsen runs a little farm where peach and apricot trees are grown. He cultivates tomatoes and has a grape orchard as well. With the requested amount, Arsen plans to buy wheat seeds and fertilizer. Arsen hopes that increased income will give him an opportunity to cover cultivation costs as well. The loan is very important for Arsen to have stable income and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Katy Lorena

texts.es: Katy de 21 años de edad vive al sur de  la ciudad, donde se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir como camisas, pantalones, vestidos y ropa infantil; actividad aprendida de su suegra,  quien la practica y con ella inició hace 4 años, las tareas de tomar medidas, pintar, cortar, preparar, acabar ensamblar  y acabar piezas y finalmente de la mano de ella, organizar una microempresa de manera conjunta. Katy vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 4 años, quien la inspira en su trabajo, y sueña que este sea  en un futuro,  un profesional exitoso y apreciado por los demás. Katy trabaja en su taller, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, especialmente en épocas de festividades, como la que se acercan al  finalizar del año,  y es cuando mas aparece,  el gran desafío de disponer de un capital de trabajo, para comprar y fabricar mucha ropa sobre medidas, que sus clientes requieren para cerrar el fin de año, con su grupo familiar muy elegantes. En la actualidad este es el propósito de Katy,  por el cual se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y aplicar a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una maquina fileteadora, telas, hilos, botones, adornos y accesorios, que darán una mayor calidad a sus productos terminados y ofrecerán una mayor distinción entre todos los que luzcan la ropa elaborada por Katy .
texts.en:
Katy is 21 years old and lives in the southern part of the city where she works sewing apparel including shirts, pants, dresses and infant clothing. She learned this trade from her mother-in-law who works in this as well and began with her four years ago. Their work includes taking measures, dyeing, cutting, prepping and putting together pieces and finally, organizing the small business together. 

Katy lives with her partner and 4 year old son who motivates her in her work. She hopes that he will be a successful and appreciated professional in the future. Katy works in her workshop from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm, especially during the holiday season which is approaching at the end of this year. Her greatest challenge is having the working capital to buy and create a lot of tailored clothing that her customers would like for the end of the year, which includes elegant apparel. This is Katy's plan which she approached Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo with to apply for a Kiva loan. With the loan she will buy a sewing machine, fabric, threads, buttons, adornments and accessories that wiill make her finished products of greater quality and offer a distinguished look to all  those who wear Katy's products.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric, threads, buttons, adornments and accessories.

loans.name: Leonela Licibeth

texts.es:
Leonela es una mujer de 25 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su Padre, a quien ama y agradece todo su apoyo brindado, ella es una persona  muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Leonela no pudo estudiar la carrea profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leonela trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Leonela se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como golosinas, gaseosas, helados y otros; de esta manera Leonela tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera incrementar sus ventas y en poco tiempo espera poder tener una tienda mejor surtida, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Leonela is a 25 year old single woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her father, in the district of Santiago. She loves her father and is thankful to all the support he has brought her. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic woman who has a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, Leonela could not study for an agronomy degree like she had hoped because she has had to work since she was very young to support her parents with their household expenses. In her free time she likes to watch television and often cooks delicious "chicharrones" to share with her family. 

Upon her own initiative and with much perseverance and dedication, Leonela works in her small business selling snacks. She works every day from early in the morning and spends about 12 hours working. She is happy working and believes that it is going well for her because of the friendliness with which she serves her customers. 

Leonela is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because she will be able to buy her merchandise with the help brought to her. These include snacks, soda and ice cream, among other items. In this way, Leonela will have a well stocked business. She hopes to increase her sales and soon hopes to have a better stocked store so that she can continue working to achieve her greatest dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise including snacks, soda and ice cream.

loans.name: Jonathan Gerardo

texts.es:
Jonathan es un joven de 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su familia, Jonathan se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Turismo, Hotelería y Gastronomía, en sus ratos libres le gusta buscar pequeños trabajos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jonathan trabaja como asistente en una empresa de turismo de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 6 horas, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Jonathan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de sus materiales de estudios, tales como libros, cuadernos, folletería, entre otros; de esta manera Jonathan seguirá estudiando y trabajando para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en un buen profesional y ser el orgullo de sus padres.
texts.en:
Jonathan, 19, is a single, young man living in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Thanks to his effort and family support, Jonathan is studying Tourism, Hotel Management and Gastronomy.  In his free time he likes to find small jobs to do and sometimes cooks a delicious “Carapulcra con Sopa Seca” to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Jonathan works as an assistant for a local tourism firm.  He works every day starting very early in the morning and works 6 hours.  He feels good doing his work and thinks he does well because of his sense of responsibility and the kind way he treats others.

Jonathan is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to buy his study materials like textbooks, notebooks, leaflets and others so that he can continue with his classes and working toward reaching his great dream of becoming a good professional and his parents' source of pride.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su esposa y su pequeño hijo, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Daniel pudo estudiar una carrera técnica, la cual le ha servido de mucho para trabajar, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas ocasiones los invita a comer un riquísimo Pollo a la Brasa, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Daniel trabaja como operador en un tragamonedas de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días, puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas y en turnos rotativos, Daniel se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque es un muy responsable y trata bien a los demás.
Daniel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder  trabajar adicionalmente brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, así pues él espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia y así poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Daniel’s a 23-year-old man living in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and little boy who he loves and are the main reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who focuses all his efforts into moving his family forward.  Thanks to his efforts, Daniel was able to study a technical career which has been very useful for him to work.  He likes to spend pleasant moments with his family in his free time and sometimes invites them to enjoy a delicious “Pollo a la Brasa” which is his favorite dish.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Daniel works as a slot machine operator in his city; he works every day on 8-hour rotating shifts.  Daniel feels good working and thinks he does well because he’s very responsible and treats others well.

Daniel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy a mototaxi that will be very useful for him because he’ll be able to have an additional job providing transportation services in his city and he can continue working and striving towards reaching his great dream of owning a house and to be able to get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy a mototaxi.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif, a married father of two girls and a boy, has been breeding chickens for three years now. In order to improve his business and increase his monthly income, Akif is requesting a loan of 1700 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy more chickens.

Akif is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Zangilan, but now lives and works in Baku region with his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens for his business.

loans.name: Mezahir

texts.en:
Mezahir is 44 years old. He is married and has two children. Mezahir lives in the Baku region with his wife and children, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person from Fizuli. 

Now he needs 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy new instruments for his work, so he can do innovation in his work. He loves his work. Mezahir has been in this construction painting business for two years.

loans.use: to buy instruments for his work.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 53, lives with her children. She has a store where she sells basic consumer products such as: beans, milk, eggs, bread and other items. She's had this business for many years, and this has given her sales experience which allows her to obtain the best earnings. Her business is located in her house, and it is in a very busy place so she gets a lot of customers. People prefer her business because she always has the products they need. She offers good quality products at affordable prices and offers unparalleled service as she is always at the call of her customers. In addition, she operates a food stall. Both businesses are doing well.

Christine is a woman who is devoted to her work. She is energetic and has a lot of goals in front of her. Her secret to success is her unwavering effort and love of her work. She knows that only in this way will she achieve what she desires. As all good merchants, she wants to grow her business and make a new investment. However, she lacks the capital to do this. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy staple consumer products, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy staple consumer products, snacks, eggs, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Beryl

texts.en:
Beryl is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. She operates a boutique shop and a beauty salon in the town of Narok and has been running the business for three years earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She took out her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD with the intent to purchase more electric gadgets for the beauty salon. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school going child.

Her dreams are to improve her living standards and start a hair dressing school.

loans.use: to purchase salon equipment.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana de 56 años de edad se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas en su barrio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con su cónyuge y su hijo  de 32 años de edad. Su experiencia en el mercado de cárnicos, data desde el año 1990, actividad que aprendió de su cónyuge y decidió iniciarla. Diana tiene un negocio donde ofrece directamente a su clientela carnes rojas por libras y estos mismos clientes le refieren otros, que hoy se han convertido en sus compradores fijos. Sus ventas las realiza  a créditos y de contado, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana todos los días y sus compras las hace en el matadero del municipio contiguo a la ciudad, donde vende la mejor carne de res. En la actualidad las ventas se han incrementado y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la demanda del mercado, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el cual comprará carne para asaderos, costillas, víscera, productos de alta rotación entre su clientela, especialmente en las fiestas de fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos, lo cual es la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Diana is 56 years old and works selling red meat in her neighborhood, located in the south of the city. She lives with her husband and her 32-year-old son. She has been working in the meat business since 1990, learning the trade from her husband and later setting up her own business. Diana's business sells red meat by the pound to the customer and the very same customers have recommended it to others who are now her regular customers. She accepts cash purchases and also gives credit, working from 7 in the morning every day. She buys her meat from a slaughterhouse in the municipality next to her city where they sell the best beef. Recently, her sales have increased and she does not have enough product to satisfy the market demand. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan with which she will buy grilling meat, ribs, and guts - products which sell very well, especially during the Christmas season. At this time, her sales and profits rise which is why her loan will bring success.

loans.use: to buy grilling meat, ribs, and guts.

loans.name: Melvis

texts.es: Melvis de 28 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 12 años y junto a su cónyuge tienen como meta el sacarlos adelante y convertirlos en profesionales, para que tengan un futuro con potencial de éxito. Desde muy pequeño el cónyuge de Melvis trabajó en el mar con su padre y cuando Melvis y él, formaron su propia familia, ella aprendió a elaborar esta herramienta de pesca, la que posteriormente se convirtiera en su negocio, por eso hoy  se dedica a la elaboración y reparación de trasmallos, atarrayas y también genera ingresos mediante el comercio de ropa en esta misma población de clientes. En el medio de los pescadores, antiguos compañeros de los esposos de Melvis, ella es muy reconocida y es allí donde se encuentra en sus principales y fieles clientes, que le llevan atarrayas y trasmallos, para que esta los repare y quedaran listos  una semana después. Melvis diariamente se acomoda en su acostumbrada silla,  empieza a entretejer entre hilos de nylon, utilizando agujas elaboradas en PVC, que algunas veces compra, mientras otras su esposo  las elabora para ella. En este mismo mercado ha conocido muchas personas y también les vende ropa exterior e interior y esta vez quiere contar con mucha existencia de mercancía, porque se acerca la navidad y el año nuevo y las familias ya han encargado la ropa que lucirán en estas fiestas llenas de alegría y muy familiares. Así Melvis se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para solicitar un credikiva, con el cual comprará materia primas e insumos para  tejer y también comprará  la ropa que vestirán sus clientes en las fiestas mas lindas del año.
texts.en:
Melvis, 28, is the mother of two children, ages 9 and 12.  She and her husband have a goal of getting them ahead and seeing them become professionals so they have the potential for success in the future.

Melvis's husband worked in the ocean with his father from a very young age.  When he and Melvis started their own family, she learned to make this fishing tool, which later she would turn into a business.   That's why today she works making and repairing trammel nets and fishnets.  She also generates income with a clothing business in this same community of customers.

In the midst of the fishermen, old friends of Melvis's husband, she's very well known, and that's where she finds her main and most loyal customers.  They bring her fishnets and trammel nets, which she'll repair and have ready for them a week later.

Every day Melvis gets comfortable in her customary chair and begins to weave with nylon thread, using needles made of PVC that sometimes she buys, sometimes her husband makes for her.  In this same market she has met a lot of people, and she also sells them clothing and underwear.  This time she wants to have a lot of merchandise because Christmas and New Year are coming and families have already ordered the clothes they'll look good in for these holidays that are full of happiness and family.

So Melvis approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request a Kiva loan with which she'll buy raw materials and supplies to weave.  She'll also buy the clothing that her customers will wear during the most beautiful celebrations of the year.

loans.use: to buy materials and supplies for weaving and to buy clothing

loans.name: Adalicia

texts.es: Adalicia con su previo credikiva compró mateias primas con los que respondió a sus pedidos de uniformes escolares y tambien le alcanzó hasta para comprar una vitrina. Ell está muy feliz y está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva, con el cual hará mejoramiento a su vivienda aplicando enchape a sus puntos humedos repallar y poner pisos. Con su anterior credikiva aumentaron sus ventas y hoy tiene mayor estabilidad económica en su hogar. Su mensaje alos finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias, por el apoyo que me han dado en mi negoco y en mi vida familiar. "
texts.en:
Adalicia leveraged support from her previous loan to purchase raw materials for sewing and completing customer orders for school uniforms and other items at her sewing business. She was also able to use part of the loan to purchase a small glass showcase for her business. Adalicia is happy to be applying for this new loan, and she plans to use the support from this loan to make improvements to her home, including applying veneer to potentially leaky roof spots, and redoing the floor.

With increased sales and a more financially stable home, Adalicia has experienced direct benefits of her previous loan. She would like to tell all Kiva lenders, "Thank you for your support of my business and my family."

loans.use: to make improvements to her home, including applying veneer to potentially leaky roof spots and redoing the floor.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es:
Claudia, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo por la venta de comida que necesita fortalecer, comprando materiales de cocina como aceite, arroz, tomates, carnes, condimentos, que le permitan tener un negocio surtido para preparar los platillos.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue un aumento en la clientela, sus ganancias fueron mejor, ya que ha tenido un negocio bien establecido, con esto puede darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en: Claudia has decided to take out another loan in order to strengthen her food sales. She will buy cooking ingredients like oil, rice, tomatoes, meat, and condiments. Her business will be stocked and she can prepare the dishes. The effect of her previous loan was an increase in customers and better earnings. Her business was already well-established. This is how she will give her daughter a better life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, tomatoes, meat, and condiments.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
José, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y ajonjolí, necesita dinero para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para fortalecer la producción del cultivo comprando abono y herbicidas para poder sacar una buena producción.
Con el préstamo anterior logro que sus cultivos incrementaran su producción, ya que aplico los insumos necesarios, los ingresos le han ayudado a mejorar sus situación en la familia, gracias al crédito otorgado su oportunidad de cubrir las necesidades del hogar han sido mejor.
texts.en: José works growing corn and sesame. He needs money to invest in the purchase of supplies to strengthen his crops; he will buy manure and herbicide to produce a good crop yield.  His previous loan helped him attain increased crop production because he applied the necessary supplies.  Income has helped to improve his family situation; thanks to the granted loan his ability to cover basic household needs has improved.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Milagro Isabel

texts.es:
Milagro, necesita invertir en el producción de granos básicos por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo que le permita la compra de abono y pagar mano de obra, tambien comprara foliares, esto le permite a Milagro realizar una buena siembra.
Comenta que el préstamo anterior significo para ella un aumento en sus ganancias provenientes de las ventas, ha comprado ropa, alimentación y medicinas a su familia, su condición económica está mejor, ayuda a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en: Milagro needs to invest in her basic grain production which is why she’s asking for a new loan to be able to buy manure and pay labor costs; she will also buy leaf fertilizers which will make it possible for Milagro to have a good crop.  She comments that her previous loan resulted in a significant increase in profits from her sales; she’s bought clothes, food and medicine for her family.  Her economic condition is better and she’s able to help her children go to school.

loans.use: to buy manure and pay labore costs.

loans.name: Noilyn

texts.es:
Noilyn es una señora empresaria. desde el 2005 empezo su empresa de servicios de estilista, bazar y venta de ropa. ella necesita de un prestamo por cuatrocientos mil colones (400.000) para poder comprar un lote y asi agrandar su negocio.
ella siempre ha luchado por darle una buena vuda a su familia, y este prestamo le ayudara a conseguir sus objetivos.
texts.en: Noilyn is a businesswoman.  She opened her beauty salon, clothing and variety store in 2005.  She needs a four-hundred thousand colones (400.000) loan to buy a lot to enlarge her business.  She’s always striven to provide a good life for her family and this loan will help her reach her objectives.

loans.use: to buy a lot.

loans.name: Ricardo Adan

texts.es:
Ricardo, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería la tienda que administra, adquiriendo pastas, boquitas, galletas, aceite, bebidas, jugos,  este préstamo será muy útil para crecer en mercadería.
Él manifiesta que el crédito anterior le proporciono el efectivo para comprarse materiales de construccion y ademas le ayudo a mantener productos de la canasta básica, aumento sus ingresos instalando el negocio de productos basicos y logro cubrir los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en: Ricardo has opted for a new loan to buy merchandise for the store he manages; he will buy noodles, snacks, cookies, oil, beverages and juices.  This loan will be very useful in order to increase merchandise.  He states that the previous loan provided the cash needed to buy construction supplies and also helped him buy basic staples.  His income increased by starting to sell basic staples and he was able to cover his children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Wilmer Ulises

texts.es:
Wilmer, desea invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con el préstamo anterior tuvo una mejor utilidad, que le anima para nuevamente comprase los materiales como 4 sacos de abono, herbicidas y foliares, para que este cultivo que tiene en proceso sea igual de provechoso.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener mejores ganancias, a través de las ventas de la cosecha, a su familia le ha comprando algunas cosas necesarias, lo mejor que ha tenido Wilmer es el envió  de uno sus hijos a la escuela (kinder).
texts.en: Wilmer wants to invest in corn and bean crops.  His previous loan led to good profits which is why he’s daring once again to buy supplies like four sacks of manure, herbicide and leaf fertilizer so that this crop he’s currently growing will be equally successful.  He was able to earn better profits with his previous loan through the sale of his crops.  He’s bought his family some needed things but the best thing Wilmer’s had is that he was able to send one of his children to school (Kindergarten).

loans.use: to buy four sacks of manure and to buy herbicide and leaf fertilizer.

loans.name: Janet S.

texts.en:
Janet S. lives in West Point. She is 32 years old, single and has two children, aged 7 and 12, who are presently in school and live at home. Janet S. is a college graduate. 

For three years now, Janet S. has been involved in the sale of fashion clothes. Most interestingly, she has many customers since her business is in a very good location in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, T-shirts, etc.) for her business. 

She plans to expand her business, build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fashion clothes (blouses, jeans, trousers, T-shirts, etc.)  for her business.

loans.name: Chuku K.

texts.en:
Chuku, 30, is a university student. She is single and lives at West Point. For the past three years, she has been operating a beauty parlor where she sells fashion dresses. She loves to do this business because it keeps her busy and she can interact with people every day. 

Because of the quality materials that she sells, she makes a profit. She first started in this business by selling at the table market. A challenge she faces is the competition on the market. With the profit generated from the business, she will buy more goods and pay her educational expenses. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more fashion dresses for the business. 

Her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion dresses for her business.

loans.name: Paulino Antonio

texts.es:
Paulino, necesita comprarse materiales para la electricidad en su residencia, comprándose los materiales como cables, poliductos, cajas rectangulares, caja térmica y otros accesorios necesarios para distribuir internamente la energía en su hogar, este será un gran avance para Paulino y su familia, mejorara su condición de vida.
Manifiesta que anteriormente su experiencia con el préstamo fue la adquisición de materiales para trabajo, hasta el momento ha sabido mantenerse, compro un vehiculo y está agradecido con Kiva por este apoyo, porque su familia ha contado con una mejoría en su vida.
texts.en:
Paulino needs to buy materials for the electricity in his house: cables, pipes, electrical boxes, a thermal box, and other accessories necessary to distribute the energy inside his home.  This will be a big step ahead for Paulino and his family; it will improve their living conditions.

He says that his previous loan was to buy materials for work.  Up to the present he has been able to support himself.  He bought a vehicle and he's thankful to Kiva for this support because his family's life has improved.

loans.use: to buy cables, pipes, electrical boxes, and a thermal box

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS TRIUNFADORAS está  compuesto por ocho integrantes seis mujeres, y dos varones, la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. YENNY tiene 30 años tiene un hijo de ocho años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos para autos ya sea ambientador, fundas, ella  vende en una estación de servicio ofreciendo sus productos a los choferes que cargan  combustible,  tiene ya muchos clientes, la Sra. YENNY es cliente antigua ya que este préstamo es el  segundo que solicito en la institución,  la Sra. YENNY va a usar este préstamo para la compra de artículos para autos al por mayor,  la Sra. YENNY enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, la Sra. YENNY se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The entrepreneurial bank Las Triunfadoras ("The Winners") is composed of eight members, of whom six are women and two are men. The president of the bank is Yenny, who is 30 years old and has an eight year old son. She dedicates herself to retail trade, offering a variety of car products such as air freshener and seat covers. She sells in a service station, offering her products to drivers while they refill oil, and she has a lot of clients. Yenny is an old borrower - this is the second loan she has asked for from the institution. Yenny is going to use this loan to buy wholesale car products. Yenny faces challenges like the demand that exists for new products in her business. She is going to use this loan to provide better service and to buy a variety of products. Yenny feels happy and grateful to the institution for providing support by granting loans.

loans.use: to buy accessories for vehicles

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, se decidió por invertir en su cultivo de hortaliza, pues desea fortalecer la producción a través de  aplicar los materiales como abono y los foliares, que son necesarios para que su cultivo sea más provechoso.
Con el préstamo anterior considera que aumento su ganancia en las ventas, junto a su esposo han logrado mantener estable el hogar.
texts.en: Maria wants to invest in vegetable growing and wishes to strengthen the crop by applying manure and plant fertilizer which are necessary for a better yield. With the previous loan, she increased her sales and, together with her husband, they have managed to maintain a stable home.

loans.use: to buy manure and plant fertilizers.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina tiene  31  años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, y vive con su esposo y su hijo en una aldea del Municipio de Azacualpa, Valle.
Doña Alejandrina lleva 5 años dedicándose al Negocio de Venta de Ropa, la cual hace de manera ambulante en las comunidades cercanas. Ofrece a  sus clientes ropa de segunda mano como: vestidos para niña, short para niños, faldas, blusas, pantalones para adultos etc.
Ella ha solicitado su tercer préstamo con Odef de 2,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en compra de mercadería  (ropa) aprovechando la temporada alta para vender, y así podrá obtener mejores ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para que su negocio siga dándole la rentabilidad para el mejoramiento de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 31, is married and has a son; she lives with her husband and son in a village in Azacualpa municipality, Valle.  She’s been selling clothes for five years from place to place in nearby communities.  She sells second-hand clothes like girls’ dresses, boys’ shorts, skirts, blouses, and pants for adults, etc.

She’s asking for her third ODEF loan for 2,000 Lempiras to buy merchandise (clothes) to take advantage of the high season to sell thus earning higher profits to continue investing in her business.  Her goal is to continue working so that her business will continue to be profitable in order to improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Peru! Este es el  grupo Las Emprendedoras

Maritza es uno de sus miembros. Ella es conviviente y tiene 05 hijos que viven con ella, su pareja  se dedica a la construcción y la apoya económicamente. Maritza tiene una bodega en su casa, empezó el negocio motivada por su hija, fue así que con el dinero de su liquidación compro algunas vitrinas y estantes para iniciar su bodega, empezó vendiendo gaseosas y algunas golosinas,  poco a poco fue abasteciendo su negocio con mas productos hasta lograr convertirse en una de las bodegas mas surtidas y visitadas por sus vecinos y amigos que son sus mejores clientes. El préstamo que Maritza ha solicitado le servirá para  comprar productos comestibles y así  incrementar su negocio, mas adelante quiere ampliar su bodega para poder atender a más clientes de su sector.
¡Maritza agradece su apoyo! ella es primera de la izquierda y viste de negro.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!  This group is “Las Emprendedoras.”

Maritza is one of its members.  She has a spouse and five children living with her. Her spouse works in construction and contributes economically.  Maritza has a grocery store at home; she started the business encouraged by her daughter.  She used money from her severance package to buy some display cases and shelving to start the store.  She started out selling soft-drinks and a few snacks and gradually increased stock adding more products until it became one of the best-stocked stores; it’s visited by neighbors and friends who are her best customers.  The loan Maritza is requesting will serve to buy food items to increase business.  Later on she wants to enlarge the store so she can tend to more local customers.  Maritza is grateful for the support and she’s the first one on the left and is wearing black.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es:
Brenda, Quiere comprar mas ropa para surtir el negocio, porque se acerca la temporada de mayor demanda, por eso a través de un nuevo préstamo quiere realizar la inversión en ropa para damas, caballeros, para niños.
Manifiesta que trabajar con el negocio a traves de crédito le permitió mejorar el negocio, incrementando la variedad en prendas de vestir, en su familia las condiciones económicas considera que han sido estables, actualmente se encuentran bien.
texts.en: Brenda wants to buy more clothes to stock her business because the season of highest demand is approaching.  She wants to use a new loan to invest in the purchase of clothes for women, men and children.  She states that running her business by means of the loan made it possible for her to improve it; she increased the variety of articles of clothing.  Her family is currently well and she considers its economic condition to be stable.

loans.use: to buy clothes for woman, men and children.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Ana Luisa de 25 años de edad, es soltera actualmente trabaja como secretaria ejecutiva y también está estudiando la carrera de licenciatura en derecho el cual cubre ella sola sus gastos universitarios, lo que para Ana es muy  importante porque su familia y ella se beneficiarían mucho obteniendo su título ya que le abre puertas y oportunidades de crecer en su ámbito laboral siendo una profesional, por esta razón solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar su curso de titulación ya que su salario no le da para cubrir de una sola vez este gasto, es por eso que acude a Afodenic para resolver su situación.
texts.en: Ana Luisa, 25, is single and currently employed as an executive secretary; she’s also studying Law and she pays all her university costs herself.  This is very important for Ana because her family and she will be greatly benefitted by her getting her degree because doors will open and job opportunities grow with her being a professional.  Because of this, she’s asking for support from a loan to be able to pay her final course fees because her salary is insufficient to be able to pay for this all at once and this is why she’s calling on Afodenic to resolve this situation.

loans.use: to pay final course fees.

loans.name: Saint Luc Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA PASCALINE est responsable du  groupe SAINT LUC.  Elle se porte bien ainsi que tout le groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. Trois(03) vont à l’école et elle a (04) personnes  en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes tissés depuis 18 mois (car elle ne tisse plus, elle achète les fils et fait tisser puis elle vend). Elle s’approvisionne chez ses voisines tisseuses. Ses clients sont les revendeurs du marché de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  02 balles  de fil à tisser.
Elle  épargne ses bénéfices. Son ambition qui était de devenir une grande vendeuse de fils de tisse à changer. Elle veut maintenant  améliorer son activité (ouvrir une boutique pour les pagnes) et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en: Ms Aminata Pascaline is the leader of the Saint Luc Group. She and the whole group are doing well.  She is married and mother of four children. The oldest is 12 years old and the youngest is 2.Three of her children attend school and she has four dependents.  For the past 18 months, A. Pascaline has sold woven "pagne" fabric. She no longer weaves so she buys yarn, has it weaved, and then sells it.  She stocks up at her neighboring weavers.  Her customers are resellers at the market in her area.  She wants to buy two bales of yarn to weave.  She saves her profits. Her ambition to become a major seller of yarn to weave has changed. She now wants to improve her business, open a store for "pagne" fabric, and help her husband take care of their family expenses.

loans.use: s’acheter  02 balles  de fil à tisser.

loans.name: Elvis

texts.es: Elvis de 47 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de dulces, refrescos productos fritos empacados, perros calientes etc. Su experiencia data desde hace 4 años, cuando se dedicaba al comercio de productos cárnicos en general y pescado, que combinaba con la venta de calzado, distribuido cliente a cliente. En estas actividades tomó su mayor experiencia, pero se sintió muy cansado y decidió establecerse en un punto comercial, fue así como aprovechando que existía un sitio de ventas de alimentos para estudiantes, en un colegio de la ciudad decidió gestionar el establecerse allí, y  dos años después, desde que la directora del plantel,  le dio esta oportunidad, la aprovechó, compró algunos enseres para funcionar, e inició pagando un arriendo mensual por el local. Sus principales compradores son los estudiantes, profesores y su sueño es hacerlo crecer, para ayudar algún día, a que sus sobrinos surjan mediante el estudio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara, pacas de productos fritos, refrescos y dulcería para aumentar sus ventas, mientras deleita el paladar de los estudiantes que le compran.
texts.en:
Elvis is 47 years old and sells candy, soft drinks, packaged fried snacks, hotdogs, etc. His experience dates from four years ago when he sold assorted meat products and fish, which he combined with the sale of footwear sold door-to-door. In these activities he gained his greatest experience, but felt very tired, and decided to set himself up in a shop. 

This was how, taking advantage of the fact that there was a stand in a local school for selling food to students, he decided to set himself up there. Two years later, as the school principal gave him this opportunity, he took advantage of it, and bought some equipment for operating it. He began paying a monthly rental for the stand.

His main customers are students and teachers, and his dream is to make it grow, so that someday he can help his nephews get ahead through education.

Currently he is applying for a loan; his first from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, by means of which he will buy packaged fried snacks, soft drinks and candy, in order to increase his sales while delighting the palate of the students who buy from him.

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks, packaged fried snacks, and natural products.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en: Silvester  is a 45 year old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 3 to 18 years. He describes himself as hard working and warm. For the past 12 years he has been operating a retail business selling doughnuts. His business is located in a viable business area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. Silvester will use his KES 8,700 loan to purchase a water tank that will be used by his family members. He plans to install it within two weeks of delivery. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM; he managed to pay off his latest loan of KES 40,000 successfully. His business goal is to open a bakery within 5 years.  He also hopes that in the future he will expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Pascasie

texts.en:
Pascasie is 33 years old. She is married to a constructor. They both have four children who all go to school. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been in that business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs such as potatoes, rice and bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, rice and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old and blessed with five children. He is a livestock trader and has been running the business for the past five years. He makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He has borrowed his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dreams is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Enver

texts.en:
Enver, 41, lives in the southern part of Kosovo. He is married and has four children between the ages of eleven and seventeen years old. 

Enver used to live in Germany, and now he receives a social pension from there and has moved back to Kosovo. For the moment, he is looking for a job, but it is very hard to find one. Since he has four children, it is very difficult for them to secure the basic things for living. 

Enver is requesting a loan in order to buy new doors and windows to prepare for wintertime. The loan will help them to have a better life with comfortable conditions. Enver hopes to offer a better education for his children. Enver and his family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to buy new doors and windows.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne is 31 years old. She is married to a driver, and they both have three children who all go to school. 

She has a boutique that she has been running for three years. With the loan, she wants to add more rice, salt, sugar and soaps for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more rice, salt and sugar for sale.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita de 61 años, convive con el padre de sus hijos, porque ellos ya dejaron el hogar. Su casa es propia y se ubica en un distrito rural de la selva central. Rita es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por sus ideales, ya que a su edad continua laborando en la actividad que más le agrada. Cuando tenía 18 años inició sus labores en la agricultura. Al lado de su esposo han sabido labrar y cultivar la tierra, para producir. Los frutos que cuida son de café, kión, plátanos y paltas. “Me gusta producir de todo, así tengo ingresos para todo el año”, menciona.
Su centro de ventas se ubica a 20 minutos de su comunidad, por ello no tiene problemas en el traslado, más si es la inversión. Dice que los fertilizantes son lo más caro en su actividad, además del pago de la mano de obra, para los cultivos y cosechas. A pesar de todo ello, Rita continúa firme en su actividad. Ahora piensa plantar más café, para ello ya tiene un vivero listo. Ella requiere de bolsas de abono orgánico para esta labor. Solicita de su apoyo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la unión palomar” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera salir adelante con el apoyo de su banco comunal, los que trabajaran arduamente para salir adelante. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de café, plátanos y paltas.
texts.en:
Rita, 61, lives with the father of her children; her children have already all left home.  Her house is hers and it’s located in a rural district in the central jungle.  

Rita is a woman who strives hard for her ideals because at her age she continues working at what she likes best.  When she was 18, she started working in agriculture.  Alongside her husband, they’ve succeeded in tilling the soil and cultivating the land to produce.  The fruits she grows are coffee, ginger, bananas and avocadoes.  “I like to grow a bit of everything so that I can earn income year-round,” she mentions.  

Her sales point is located 20 minutes from her community so she doesn’t have any transportation problems but she does have them with regard to investment.  She says that fertilizers are the most expensive in her activity and so are labor costs during planting and harvesting.  Despite all this, Rita continues firm in her activity. She’s now planning to plant more coffee and has her nursery ready for this.  She needs bags of organic manure for this work and she’s asking for your support.

She belongs to the “Prestatarios de la Unión Palomar” (Palomar Union Borrowers) and this is the third MFP loan.  She hopes to get ahead with support from her communal bank who work hard to get ahead.  She promises to be punctual with her payments too.  She will be able to buy bags of organic manure for her coffee, banana and avocado crops with the money.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Elmer Noe

texts.es:
Elmer, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos, él se dedica a la venta de plátanos, este negocio surge por la intensión de buscar una alternativa para proveer a su familia lo necesario, lo realiza desde hace dos años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de plátanos verdes, para mantener la suficiente cantidad en el negocio, esto le ayudara para mejorar sus ganancias debido a que tendrá la capacidad de vender a los clientes, Además tendrá la posibilidad de realizar la compra por mayoreo y a bajo precio.
Su aspiración es mejorar sus ingresos económicos a su familia, ya que esto le permitirá que la calidad de vida sea mejor.
texts.en:
Elmer lives with his wife and four children.  He makes a living selling bananas.  This business came about with the intention of finding an alternative for providing for his family's needs.  He has been doing it for two years.

He's requesting a loan to buy green bananas to keep a sufficient quantity in his business.  This will help him improve his profits because he'll be able to sell to his customers.  Also, it will be possible for him to buy wholesale at a low price.

His goal is to improve his family's income because this will allow their quality of life to be better.

loans.use: to buy green bananas

loans.name: Mukony

texts.en:
Mukony is 35 years old, married and supports a family of six people. He has been a maize farmer for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). 

He is servicing a second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married businessman who carries out the transport of goods and people through a public service vehicle; this is a trade he has run for five years.
 
He learned of Milango from a friend two years ago and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 104,750 Kenya shillings to service the vehicle. 

The only challenge in the business is the high cost of spare parts and fluctuating fuel prices, but Joseph is determined to carry out his operations well because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can provide for the basic needs of his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase a larger public service vehicle.

loans.use: To service the vehicle.

loans.name: Kankelentigui Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe KANKELENTIGUI    sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba un des nouveaux quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme Dounaba fait le commerce  des habits  dans ce groupe de femmes de  KANKELENTIGUI elle se tient en première position de  la gauche vers la droite. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax et 5 pièces de bazin  qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 87 500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en: The five members of the Kankelentigui Group are married women with an average age of 39. They have an average of five children.  They mostly live in monogamous families in the Babemba area, one of the new neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso, the 3rd largest administrative region of Mali. In order to better satisfy their customers' needs, they are on their tenth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, the microfinance organization.  Ms. Dounaba sells clothing and she is the first person (from left to right) in the photo.  She plan to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of "pagne" fabric and five pieces of "bazin" fabric that she will resale retail for cash at her family home to a clientele of mostly women. She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 87,500 FCFA, which will be partially used to repay her loan and interest and partially saved.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gurgen

texts.en: Gurgen lives with his wife and son in Sardarapat village, in the Armavir region.  He is 54 years old and has more than 30 years of experience in the agricultural field. He runs a farm where he grows 300 plum trees. As the operating costs of such a big farm are high Gurgen needs some capital to cover them; that’s why he has applied for this loan. With the requested amount he plans to purchase fertilizer and 350 plum saplings, which will significantly expand his farm and allow him to cover other operational costs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and 350 plum saplings

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah lives with her husband in the town of Samburu. She and her husband work from home. She works selling clothes that she makes, like shorts and girls’ dresses, and doing tailoring work. She works almost every day and has been doing so for two years. Hannah is requesting a loan to buy fabric at wholesale which she will use to make the clothes she sells. She will also buy supplies she needs like zippers, buttons and thread.  Hannah’s dream is to earn more income from the business during the end-of-year festivities, and to have more comfort.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, and thread

loans.name: Liana

texts.en: Liana is a 25-year-old woman who lives in the Agarak region with her parents. She is the only breadwinner in the family. She runs a farm where she grows apricot, peach, blood orange, pomegranate and fig trees. She also keeps a cow, but has no capital to acquire more livestock; that’s why she has applied for this loan. With the requested amount Liana plans to purchase one more cow and a calf. This will increase her income and will give her an opportunity to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and a calf

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Gina  es uno de los miembros del grupo Las Águilas

Gina tiene 26 años. Ella vive con su pareja y su hijo pequeño. Gina se dedica a la venta de dulces caseros, aprendió este oficio gracias a su mama que  le enseño a prepararlos, ya son 02 años que se dedica a este negocio y diariamente recorre diferentes lugares para ofrecer su producto, gracias a su empeño tiene muchos clientes esto le permite tener ingresos para ayudar con los gastos de la familia. Gina sueña con tener un negocio estable  en su casa, el préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá para la compra de  utensilios nuevos para mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
 ¡Gina agradece el apoyo de los inversores KIVA! Ella es la segunda de la izquierda esta parada y viste casaca azul.
texts.en:
Gina is a member of the communal bank " Las Águilas."

Gina is 26 years old, and she lives with her partner and her small son.  Gina has a business selling homemade sweets.  She learned this trade thanks to her mother, who taught her how to prepare them.  She's had this business for 2 years already, and she goes around daily to different places to offer her products for sale.  Thanks to her efforts, she has a lot of customers.  This allows her to have income to help with the family's expenses.  

Gina dreams of having a stable business in her home.  She will invest this loan in new utensils that will allow her to provide her customers with better service.  

Gina appreciates the support of the Kiva lenders!  She is the second from the left; she's standing and is wearing a blue jacket.

loans.use: to buy new utensils

loans.name: Wakio

texts.en: Wakio is 27 years old and lives with her husband and three children. She is dedicated to her work as a shopkeeper, and has worked in her store for a year now. She began working with her parents and still does. The loan she needs is to resupply her store with groceries; she plans to buy food stuffs, basic grains, cleaning products, etc.  This will help her increase her income. Among her principal dreams is to have other stores and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs, basic grains, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Abdullah Group

texts.en: This group is called Abdullah and consists of five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. Saidh is a 41-year-old married woman with nine children. She owns a home and is a housewife who intends on working hard. Saidh is applying for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction supplies for her house. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for her house.

loans.name: Dubis Esther

texts.es: Dubis de 49 años, de edad se dedica a la confección de ropa, bolsos y al comercio en general, en su vivienda donde tiene su propio taller y un punto de ventas. En sus 27 años de experiencia Dubis  ha trabajado junto a su madre, quien la inició en el negocio de la modistería desde muy joven, hasta que ella misma logró comprar sus máquinas poco a poco, ponerse a trabajar sobre medidas y crear la clientela con la que hoy cuenta, la que cada día crece y esta es la razón por la que su capital de trabajo se muestra insuficiente para responder a la demanda del mercado. En su taller se realizan las operaciones de diseño, corte preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas y también la comercialización de ellos en punto de venta, al que últimamente ha agregado artículos de miscelánea, para el hogar, papelería etc. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente de contado y sus compras también, en almacenes especializados en la ciudad de Barranquilla. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas, e insumos de modistería y artículos navideños, aprovechando que la navidad se acerca y que su negocio debe estar muy bien surtido, para poder cumplir cabalmente su meta de crecimiento y ver finalmente a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales exitosos, tal y como los sueña.
texts.en:
Dubis is 49 years old, works making clothing and handbags, and also engages in general sales. She has her own workshop and sales location in her home. 

In her 27 years of experience, Dubis has worked with her mother, who got her started in the dressmaking business from a young age, until she herself managed to buy her machines little by little. She began working on custom clothing and building the clientele she now has, which grows each day. 

This is the reason why her working capital is proving insufficient to respond to market demand. In her workshop she does design work, cutting out, preparation, assembly and finishing of pieces, and also sells them at her shop. 

Recently at her shop, she has added miscellaneous articles for the home, stationery, etc. She sells and makes her purchases, mainly on a cash basis. She buys from specialized stores in the city of Barranquilla. 

Currently she is applying for credikiva loan, her third from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. By means of the loan, she will buy fabric and dressmaking supplies, as well as Christmas articles, taking advantage of the fact that Christmas is approaching. Her business must be well supplied so that she can fully meet her goal of expanding, and eventually see her children become successful professionals, just as she dreams.

loans.use: To buy fabric, dressmaking supplies, and Christmas articles.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 24 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She sells shoes and has been in the business for 7 years. With the loan, she wants to buy more used shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used for building her home.
